Instruction: Slice the beef sirloin or tenderloin into thin strips, about 1/4 inch thick.
Season the beef strips with salt and black pepper, then toss them with all-purpose flour until evenly coated.
Heat butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the seasoned beef strips to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 3-4 minutes. Remove the beef from the skillet and set it aside.
In the same skillet, add chopped onion and minced garlic. Cook until softened and fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.
Add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown, about 5 minutes.
Return the cooked beef strips to the skillet.
Pour beef broth into the skillet, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom.
Stir in Dijon mustard and Worcestershire sauce. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 5-10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld and the sauce to thicken slightly.
While the sauce is simmering, cook egg noodles according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Once the sauce has thickened slightly, remove the skillet from the heat.
Stir in sour cream until well combined, being careful not to let the sauce come to a boil.
Taste the sauce and adjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve the beef stroganoff over cooked egg noodles, garnished with fresh chopped parsley if desired.
Enjoy your delicious and creamy Beef Stroganoff!
